page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = a5_has_permission(C name ,C class ,C permission [,L lUI [,C user_name [,C master_password ]]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: .T. = The specified user has the indicated permission to the object. .F. = The user does not have the indicated permission.

argument.name: name
argument.description: The name of the object and the data dictionary that contains it.

argument.name: class
argument.description: The type of object for which you are changing permissions. Valid values are:

item.name: Object Class (Filename Extension of Data Dictionary used in Name parameter)

argument.name: permission
argument.description: The permission that is being changed. Valid values are:

argument.name: lUI
argument.description:
Logical. Whether to display a message if permission is denied. Possible values are:
.T. = Display a message.
.F. = Do not display a message.

argument.name: user_name
argument.description: Optional. The default is the current user.

argument.name: master_password
argument.description: Optional. The master password for the database.

page.description: Returns whether a user has access to an object
page.discussion: The A5_HAS_PERMISSION() function tests whether a user has the specified permission to an object. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
